titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Ralph E. Pickett Papers MC.104
titlestmt.author: Jacqueline Rider

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-01-21 14:38:46 -0500.

did.abstract: Ralph E. Pickett was Secretary of the Faculty and Assistant Dean of the School of Education at New York University from 1935 to 1941. This collection consists of a manuscript he wrote in 1961.
did.physloc: Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please request materials at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Ralph E. Pickett was Secretary of the Faculty and Assistant Dean of the School of Education from 1935 to 1941.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Repository permission is required for access. Please contact New York University Archives, (212) 998-2641, university-archives@nyu.edu.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) held by the creator are maintained by New York University. Permission to publish or reproduce materials in this collection must be secured from New York University Archives, (212) 998-2646, university-archives@nyu.edu.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known), Ralph E. Pickett Papers, MC 104, folder number, New York University Archives, New York University Libraries.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Materials were placed in archival boxes and folders.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of a manuscript written by Ralph E. Pickett in 1961.

did.unittitle: Recurring Themes in Art, Literature, Music, Drama, and Dance as Found in Various Episodes of Classical Mythology, Religion, and History Vol. 1
